title: Canteen (Hard Version)
statementHtml:
This is the hard version of the problem. The difference between the versions is that in this version, there are no additional limits on kk. You can hack only if you solved all versions of this problem.

Ecrade has two sequences a0,a1,…,an−1a0,a1,…,an−1 and b0,b1,…,bn−1b0,b1,…,bn−1 consisting of integers. It is guaranteed that the sum of all elements in aa does not exceed the sum of all elements in bb.

Initially, Ecrade can make exactly kk changes to the sequence aa. It is guaranteed that kk does not exceed the sum of aa. In each change:

Then Ecrade will perform the following three operations sequentially on aa and bb, which constitutes one round of operations:

Ecrade wants to know the minimum number of rounds required for all elements in aa to become equal to 00 after exactly kk changes to aa.

However, this seems a bit complicated, so please help him!
inputSpecHtml:
Each test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases tt (1≤t≤2⋅1041≤t≤2⋅104). The description of the test cases follows.

The first line of each test case contains two integers nn, kk (1≤n≤2⋅1051≤n≤2⋅105, 0≤k≤2⋅10140≤k≤2⋅1014).

The second line of each test case contains nn integers a0,a1,…,an−1a0,a1,…,an−1 (1≤ai≤1091≤ai≤109).

The third line of each test case contains nn integers b0,b1,…,bn−1b0,b1,…,bn−1 (1≤bi≤1091≤bi≤109).

It is guaranteed that the sum of nn across all test cases does not exceed 2⋅1052⋅105. It is also guaranteed that in each test case the sum of aa does not exceed the sum of bb, and that kk does not exceed the sum of aa.
outputSpecHtml: For each test case, output the minimum number of rounds required for all elements in aa to become equal to 00 after exactly kk changes to aa.
noteHtml:
In the fifth test case, all elements in aa become 00 after exactly 66 changes.

In the sixth test case, Ecrade can do exactly one change to a3a3, then aa will become [1,2,2,4][1,2,2,4].

  • After the first round, a=[3,0,0,0],b=[3,1,0,0]a=[3,0,0,0],b=[3,1,0,0];
  • After the second round, a=[0,0,0,0],b=[0,1,0,0]a=[0,0,0,0],b=[0,1,0,0].

In the seventh test case, Ecrade can do exactly one change to a4a4, then aa will become [2,1,1,1][2,1,1,1].

  • After the first round, a=[0,1,0,0],b=[0,1,1,0]a=[0,1,0,0],b=[0,1,1,0];
  • After the second round, a=[0,0,0,0],b=[0,0,1,0]a=[0,0,0,0],b=[0,0,1,0].
